subject: Sleep
title: Light Therapy for Mood and Sleep
description: A micro-lesson that makes Light Therapy for Mood and Sleep usable.

hook.text: A box that shines bright light at you every morning can treat depression. It sounds ridiculous. It works.

buildup.text: Light therapy uses 10,000 lux bright light for 20 to 30 minutes each morning to reset the circadian clock.

discovery.text: It was developed for seasonal depression but is now effective for non-seasonal depression and sleep disorders.

twist.text: Morning light advances the circadian clock, shifting sleep earlier and improving both sleep quality and mood.

climax.text: Some studies show light therapy works as fast as antidepressants and enhances their effect when combined.

punchline.text: Sometimes the cure for depression is just the right amount of light.

quiz.question: How does morning light therapy help with depression?
options: It causes vitamin D production in the skin
It resets the circadian clock and improves both sleep and mood
It only works for seasonal depression
